verses.plain: Wisdom hath builded her house, she hath hewn out her seven pillars:

tokens.t: Wisdom hath builded her house, she hath hewn out her seven pillars:

verses.plain: She hath killed her beasts; she hath mingled her wine; she hath also furnished her table.

tokens.t: She hath killed her beasts; she hath mingled her wine; she hath also furnished her table.

verses.plain: She hath sent forth her maidens: she crieth upon the highest places of the city,

tokens.t: She hath sent forth her maidens: she crieth upon the highest places of the city,

verses.plain: Whoso is simple, let him turn in hither: as for him that wanteth understanding, she saith to him,

tokens.t: Whoso
simple, let him turn in hither:
him that wanteth understanding, she saith to him,

verses.plain: Come, eat of my bread, and drink of the wine which I have mingled.

tokens.t: Come, eat of my bread, and drink of the wine
I have mingled.

verses.plain: Forsake the foolish, and live; and go in the way of understanding.

tokens.t: Forsake the foolish, and live; and go in the way of understanding.

verses.plain: He that reproveth a scorner getteth to himself shame: and he that rebuketh a wicked man getteth himself a blot.

tokens.t: He that reproveth a scorner getteth to himself shame: and he that rebuketh a wicked
himself a blot.

verses.plain: Reprove not a scorner, lest he hate thee: rebuke a wise man, and he will love thee.

tokens.t: Reprove not a scorner, lest he hate thee: rebuke a wise man, and he will love thee.

verses.plain: Give instruction to a wise man, and he will be yet wiser: teach a just man, and he will increase in learning.

tokens.t: Give
to a wise
, and he will be yet wiser: teach a just
, and he will increase in learning.

verses.plain: The fear of the LORD is the beginning of wisdom: and the knowledge of the holy is understanding.

tokens.t: The fear of the
the beginning of wisdom: and the knowledge of the holy
understanding.

verses.plain: For by me thy days shall be multiplied, and the years of thy life shall be increased.

tokens.t: For by me thy days shall be multiplied, and the years of thy life shall be increased.

verses.plain: If thou be wise, thou shalt be wise for thyself: but if thou scornest, thou alone shalt bear it.

tokens.t: If thou be wise, thou shalt be wise for thyself: but
thou scornest, thou alone shalt bear

verses.plain: ¶ A foolish woman is clamorous: she is simple, and knoweth nothing.

tokens.t: ¶ A foolish woman
clamorous:
simple, and knoweth nothing.

verses.plain: For she sitteth at the door of her house, on a seat in the high places of the city,

tokens.t: For she sitteth at the door of her house, on a seat in the high places of the city,

verses.plain: To call passengers who go right on their ways:

tokens.t: To call passengers who go right on their ways:

verses.plain: Whoso is simple, let him turn in hither: and as for him that wanteth understanding, she saith to him,

tokens.t: Whoso
simple, let him turn in hither: and
him that wanteth understanding, she saith to him,

verses.plain: Stolen waters are sweet, and bread eaten in secret is pleasant.

tokens.t: Stolen waters are sweet, and bread
in secret is pleasant.

verses.plain: But he knoweth not that the dead are there; and that her guests are in the depths of hell.

tokens.t: But he knoweth not that the dead
there;
her guests
in the depths of hell.
